    • Automata

      public Automata​(java.lang.String name)
      Constructor of Automata. To load the Automata, use loadAutomata.
      Parameters:
      name - Automata's name

  • Method Details

    • verify

      public boolean verify​(java.lang.String sentance)
      Verify if a sentane respect the Automata.
      Parameters:
      sentance - the sentance to verify
      Returns:
      true if respect the Automata, false if not

    • addState

      public void addState​(State s)
      Adding a state to all the state of the Automata
      Parameters:
      s - State to add

    • addCharacter

      public void addCharacter​(char c)

      Parameters:

    • addTransition

      public void addTransition​(java.lang.String stateName1, char c, java.lang.String stateName2)
      Adding a transition in s1 to s2 with char c
      Parameters:
      stateName1 - Name of the state you want to add transition
      c - char who give access to stateName2
      stateName2 - Name of the state you want to access with char c

    • setInitial

      public void setInitial​(java.lang.String nameState)
      Set the initial State
      Parameters:
      nameState - name of the State

    • addFinal

      public void addFinal​(java.lang.String nameState)
      Adding a final state with his name
      Parameters:
      nameState - name of the State

    • getName

      public java.lang.String getName()
      Getter for the name of the Automata
      Returns:
      the name of the Automata

    • loadAutomata

      public void loadAutomata​(java.lang.String filename)
      Load an Automata with a filename. The automata must respect the format explain in ExplainationAutomataFile.txt
      Parameters:
      filename - the filename of your automata

    • toString

      public java.lang.String toString()
      toString for Automata : the format is : State1 -> {State2[charToAcces1,charToAcces2..]} State1 with the charToAcces acces to State2.
      Overrides:
      toString in class java.lang.Object
      Returns:
      String of the Automata

    • isInitialised

      public boolean isInitialised()
      Function to verify if an Automata is initialised
      Returns:
      true if it's initialised, false if not
